meanings.definition: A person who learns the role of another in order to serve as a replacement if needed.
meanings.sent1: The understudy was ready to step in for the lead actor.
meanings.sent2: The theater production had an understudy prepared for every main role.
meanings.sent3: The understudy accidentally memorized all the lines of the main actor too.
meanings.sent4: Being an understudy is like being a backup singer in a band.
meanings.sent5: The understudy's dedication to learning multiple roles was impressive.

meanings.definition: To learn the role of another in order to serve as a replacement if needed.
meanings.sent1: She had to understudy the lead actress at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: He agreed to understudy the main character in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: Understudying for the role made him appreciate the main actor's hard work.
meanings.sent4: Learning to understudy requires flexibility and quick thinking.
meanings.sent5: She decided to understudy the role to gain more experience in acting.
